availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Mayes (Fulton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Virginia F. Mayes. Father of Calpurna F. Mayes, Lucy E. Mayes, George F. Mayes, Susan J. Mayes, James W. Mayes, Ira V. Mayes, William D. Mayes, and John D. Mayes. Farmer in Fulton County in 1850. Employed Jefferson Thompson as a laborer in Fulton County in 1850. Farmer in Fulton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 115B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 414.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, Hickman/District 3, p. 245B.
Find A Grave, "J W Mayes (1821-1905)," Memorial #126055790, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126055790 (accessed September 9, 2020).
